meanings.definition: To remove or bring out of a kennel.
meanings.sent1: The dog was unkennelling itself from the small kennel.
meanings.sent2: The animal shelter worker was unkennelling the puppies for their playtime.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept unkennelling its siblings for a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: She felt like unkennelling her thoughts, letting them out into the open.
meanings.sent5: The act of unkennelling the memories brought a sense of freedom.

meanings.definition: To reveal or uncover something hidden or secret.
meanings.sent1: The detective was unkennelling the truth behind the mysterious case.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist was unkennelling ancient artifacts buried deep underground.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved unkennelling a rabbit from his hat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to unkennel the joy she had been hiding inside.
meanings.sent5: The old map unkennelled the location of the hidden treasure.
